concept.title: Definitions
concept.shortdesc: This handbook uses terms that have specific meanings with regard to their use.

dlentry.dd: The learning management system (LMS) in use at Virginia Tech.
A specific instance of a course section including all of its students.
The entire ENGL 3764: Technical Writing offering, which consists of scheduled lessons to be delivered in an online format over the duration of a scheduled semester.
The official catalog number and name of this course. The virtual classroom offering uses the same course number and name as the traditional face-to-face offering of the course.
The primary online platform for managing the entire virtual class. Currently, Virginia Tech uses and supports Canvas as an LMS.

The delivery of one or more topics, delivered in online postings over the entire semester. The number of lessons per semester depends on whether the semester is a regular semester, summer session, or winter session. For example, typically a regular semester has one lesson posted per week while the winter session has one lesson posted per weekday.
The online mechanism in Canvas that allows you to organize and deliver lessons.

A Virginia Tech organization that provides training and resources for faculty and students engaged in technology-based activities. They are a resource that can help in your online teaching efforts. You can obtain more information about TLOS at https://tlos.vt.edu/.

A specific subject taught within the course. One or more topics could be covered in the same lesson. For example, proposals and recommendation reports are two separate topics; however, both could be presented in the same lesson depending on the class schedule.
